contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2011}} In [[Canada]], the '''Dean of the House''' is the Member of the [[House of Commons of Canada|House of Commons]] with the longest unbroken record of service who is not a [[Minister (government)|Cabinet Minister]], party Leader, [[House Leader]] or [[Whip (politics)|Whip]].<ref>Election of the Speaker of the House. House of Commons. Canada. March 2006. Last accessed July 1, 2009. [http://www.parl.gc.ca/compendium/web-content/c_d_electionspeakerhouse-e.htm]</ref> The Dean is responsible for presiding over the election of the [[Speaker of the House of Commons of Canada|Speaker of the House of Commons]] at the beginning of each Parliament. The position is the equivalent of the [[Father of the House]] in the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]]. The current Dean of the House is [[Bloc Québécois]] [[Member of Parliament (Canada)|MP]] [[Louis Plamondon]], who was first elected to the Commons as a member of the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada|Progressive Conservative Party]] in 1984.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thestar.com/article/192614|title=Veteran MP set to retire|publisher=[[The Toronto Star]]|date=May 16, 2007|last=Campion-Smith|first=Bruce}}</ref> ==List of Deans== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 | Member !
